subject: Re: [junit] What assertEqual does internally to test our cost?
msgSnippet: to one of my querieis in the past, someone replied saying that the assertEquals method uses Object.equals() to compare. There could be various ways of testing
messageBody:
to one of my querieis in the past, someone replied saying that the
assertEquals method uses Object.equals() to compare.

There could be various ways of testing the method startTransfer -
however, to me, that sounds more like an integration test. you are
sending data to an external server. But on the other hand, if you
create mock TFTP server or at least mock the stub of that tftp server
and satisfy yourself with testing against the stub, then unit testing
it should be a breeze.

-Eagle


On Thu, 24 Feb 2005 09:42:33 -0000, Kandasamy
<getready20032001@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi
>
>
> What assertEqual() does internally to test our cost? Is it
> comparing each variable of that particular class or it is doing
> something extra?
>
> i am writing my TestTftp() like
>
> //Creating sample object
> private InetAddress ipAddr;
> String ip="10.201.114.140";
> ipAddr=InetAddress.getByName(ip);
> TftpConnection tftptst = new TftpConnection(ipAddr,
>
>
>
> "D:\\tftp\\test.txt","test.txt");
>
>
> //Creating object by using the result arguments got frm tftptst object
> ipAddr=InetAddress.getByName(tftptst.getHost());
> TftpConnection tftptstexp = new TftpConnection(ipAddr,
> tftptst.getSrcFileName(),
>
> tftptst.getDestFileName());
>
> //comparing two Objects
> assertEquals(tftptstexp,tftptst)
>
>
> In this case my TftpConnection class have lot more function
> other than constructor and get methods which are specified here.
>
> Is i have to write Testfuction that test all other functions
> which are like startTranfer() which Take care of framing the data
> packet and sending it to TFTP server over TFTP protocal.
>
> That function look like
>
> private void startTranfer(tftpobj)
> {
> // steps to read the content from file
>
> //steps to frame packet of 512 bytes
>
> //sending the packet over TFTP
>
> //cheking the responce from TFTP server.
> }
>
>
> How i can test this function.
>
>
> regards
> kanda
